helpMessage.title: Help
helpMessage.description:
This message. Type `.help` (or equivalent) and then a command name to see its explanation:
```
.? is```
helpMessage.helpText:
**__Help__**
This is **Discordsworn**, a dice rolling bot for _Ironsworn_ and other systems.
To request a feature or check out the code, go to: https://github.com/ribbanya/discordsworn/issues

To use a command, type `.` and then a command name from the list below.

You can also `@` ping me, in which case you do not need the `.`:
${selfPing} `ironsworn-action`

You can also directly message me (without the `.`):
```
ironsworn-action```

__**Commands**__
${helpList}

is_rollActionDice.title: Ironsworn Action Roll
is_rollActionDice.description: Performs an Action Roll from the _Ironsworn_ engine.

fields.name: _Ironsworn_ Action Roll
fields.value: Performs an Action Roll from the _Ironsworn_ engine.

fields.name: Quick Reference
fields.value:
```
.is Sojourning into the town with +2 heart and +1 from Secure Advantage.
``````
.a 2 1```

fields.name: Details
fields.value:
To perform an Action Roll, simply use the `ironsworn-action` command or one of its aliases. You may include any number of whole numbers, which will be counted as modifiers. Text is ignored, which allows you to add a description to your rolls:
```
.ironsworn-action Rolling to Compel the guard to let me pass by telling him I have business with the Prince. +2 Shadow and +1 for my Secure Advantage.```The command has a few aliases (`a`, `is`, and `act`). All you need are the numeric modifiers; the text is purely for flavour. All aliases function exactly the same:
```
.is Compelling the guard by lying: +2 Shadow, +1 Secure Advantage``````
.act Compel +2 s +1 SA````+`'s can be omitted, as well as any text:
```
.a 2 1```You can put as much text, and as many modifiers, into a roll as Discord's 2,000-character limit will allow.

fields.name: Quick Reference
fields.value:
```
.o f Heads or tails?
``````
.o l``````
.o t iln What is the merchant's name?``````
.o t r```

fields.name: Yes/No Questions
fields.value:
To _Ask_ a yes or no question, start with the `oracle` command and then an Odds keyword. Then, optionally, add a description:
```
.oracle unlikely Will this work?
```_Ask_ the same question, but with a different command name and abbreviated Odds keyword (`ul` for 'unlikely'):
```
.ask ul Will this work?
```_Ask_ the same question, but with no description, the shortest command name, and the numeric equivalent of the Unlikely keyword (25%):
```
.o 25
```

fields.name: Tables
fields.value:
To consult an _Oracle_ table, start with the `oracle` command, then the word `table`, then the keyword for the table you wish to consult:
```
.oracle table elf-names
```You can abbreviate `oracle` and `table` to `o` and `t`, respectively, and each table has its own shorthand

fields.name: Using Table Keywords
fields.value:
Underlined letters indicate the abbreviation for a table:
```
.o t cwl
```When specifying tables with multiple words, replace spaces with dashes:
```
.o t coastal-waters-location
```Terms can be lowercase, but need not be:
```
.ORACLE TABLE Coastal-Waters-Location
```

aw_rollMoveDice.title: Apocalypse World Move Roll
aw_rollMoveDice.description: Performs a Move roll from the _Apocalypse World_ engine.

fields.name: _Apocalypse World_ Move Roll
fields.value: Performs a Move roll from the _Apocalypse World_ engine.

fields.name: Quick Reference
fields.value:
```
.aw Going Aggro on the bartender with +2 hard and +1 forward.
``````
.m 2 1```

fields.name: Details
fields.value:
To perform a Move, simply use the `apocalypse-world-move` command or one of its aliases. You may include any number of whole numbers, which will be counted as modifiers. Text is ignored, which allows you to add a description to your rolls:
```.apocalypse-world-move Rolling to Manipulate the guard to let me pass by telling him I have business with the gang leader. +2 hot and +1 forward from earlier.```The command has a few aliases (`aw`, `move`, and `m`). All you need are the numeric modifiers; the text is purely for flavour. All aliases function exactly the same:
```.aw Manipulating the guard by lying: +2 hot, +1 forward``````.move Manipulate +2 h +1 F````+`'s can be omitted, as well as any text:
```.m 2 1```You can put as much text, and as many modifiers, into a roll as Discord's 2,000-character limit will allow.

rollDice.title: Roll Any Dice
rollDice.description: Rolls an expression in dice notation.

reconnectDiscordClient.title: Reconnect Client
reconnectDiscordClient.description: Severs the connection to Discord, then reopens it.

exitProcess.title: Exit Process
exitProcess.description: Shuts down the connection to Discord, then exits the script.

embedWatch.title: Watch a file for changes, and embed it as JSON
